summary: This is a Palm Beach Police Department incident report detailing aggressive surveillance of a witness by a private investigator working for Jeffrey Epstein's new legal team in May 2006. It also analyzes phone records from March 2006 showing calls between the witness, a victim, and numbers linked to Epstein's corporate network, corroborating the victim's account of intimidation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case; his new legal team is reported to have hired private investigators who are aggressively following a witness. His corporate address and entities are identified in phone record analysis.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: An attorney scheduled to meet with a witness on June 1, 2006. The witness later informs the police about this meeting.

persons.name: Sarah Kellen
persons.context: Identified as 'Epstein's assistant'. The witness called her for 48 seconds immediately after a series of calls with a victim on March 7, 2006.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Described as Epstein's corporation attorney who registered Epstein's businesses and listed himself as an agent at the 457 Madison Ave corporate address.

connections.description: Indyke is identified as Epstein's corporation attorney who registered his businesses.
Kellen is identified as Epstein's assistant and was called by a witness immediately after the witness spoke with a victim.
The report states Epstein had retained new legal counsel, and a meeting was scheduled with Attorney Jack Goldberger and a witness.

events.title: Witness reports aggressive surveillance
events.description: A witness reports receiving multiple calls about being aggressively followed by a private investigator in a green Chevy, whose license plate was traced to an investigator from Florida.

events.title: Series of phone calls between witness, victim, and Epstein network
events.description: Phone records show a sequence of calls: a witness calls a victim, the victim calls back, they have a long call, then the witness immediately calls Epstein's assistant Sarah Kellen, followed by calls from a number registered to Epstein's corporate address.

events.title: Meeting with Attorney Jack Goldberger
events.description: A meeting was scheduled and occurred between a witness and Attorney Jack Goldberger at 9:00 am. The witness later telephoned the police to inform them about it.

events.title: Spring Break period
events.description: Spring Break was confirmed to be from March 4 through March 12, 2006. Phone records for this period were subpoenaed.

keyFacts: A witness in the Epstein case reported being aggressively followed by a private investigator in May 2006, which police attributed to Epstein's new legal team.

Phone record analysis from March 2006 shows a call sequence between a witness and a victim, immediately followed by the witness calling Epstein's assistant Sarah Kellen and receiving calls from Epstein's corporate number.

Jeffrey Epstein had multiple corporations (El Zorro Ranch, New York Strategy Group, Ghislaine Corporation, etc.) registered to the same address: 457 Madison Ave in New York, with attorney Darren Indyke listed as the agent.
The phone record pattern on March 7, 2006, was consistent with the victim's prior description of an intimidation event.
Contact between the witness and the victim, as well as between the witness and Epstein/Kellen, ceased after March 7, 2006, for the remainder of March and April.
